original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs. 99 bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields fell across maturities at Wednesday’s auction while 99 million bills were sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office accepted 70 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 19.08 percent, fell by 129 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 52 billion rupees.
45 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 16.95 percent, fell by 102 basis points from a week earlier after offering 30 billion rupees.
45 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 14.04 percent, fell by 18 basis points from a week earlier after offering 16 billion. (Colombo/July12/2023)
